Shift Production Manager Job at Rotic Aluminium Extrusion




        
    

        
        Rotic Aluminium Extrusion is a steadily growing aluminium extrusion companyin Anambra. We are dedicated to delivering the highest standard of aluminium extrusion profiles. Our seasoned team of experts ensures that each product we create embodies precision and craftsmanship.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Shift Production Manager

Job Location: Awka, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Shift Production Manager will oversee daily shop floor operations across the entire Aluminium extrusion production chain from the melting of Aluminium scrap to the packaging of finished aluminium profiles.
	This role ensures that production targets are met safely, efficiently, and at the highest quality, while driving continuous improvement.


Responsibilities


	Supervise all production activities during your assigned shift
	Allocate manpower and oversee operator performance
	Monitor production output and take corrective actions as needed
	Enforce safety, quality, and housekeeping standards on the shopfloor
	Coordinate with logistics, maintenance, and QA teams
	Reduce downtime and material wastage through lean practices
	Maintain accurate shift reports and handover summaries
	Train and guide operators on SOPs and quality requirements


Requirements


	HND / BSc in Engineering or related technical field.
	Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a manufacturing shift leadership or shift supervisor role.
	Strong knowledge of shop floor operations, lean manufacturing practices, & TPM methodologies.
	Excellent team coordination, discipline enforcement, and problem-solving skills.
	Must be results-driven with strong attention to safety and output targets.


Benefits


	Renumeration: N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.
	Competitive salary
	HMO health coverage
	Daily free meals
	Company-provided accommodation
	Relocation support


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@roticaluminium.com using "Shift Production Manager" as the subject of the mail.

Note: We will be considering applicants as they apply, so please do not delay in submitting your application. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Job Openings at Estrada International Staffing Solutions
content:
Estrada International Staffing Solutions is a strategic boutique specialist recruitment consulting firm, serving clients with expertise recruitment services across all sectors ranging from Banking, Insurance, Oil and Gas, Telecommunications, FMCGs and Construction, with the aim of satisfying their recruitment needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Accountant

Job Location: Ketu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Financial Services- Microfinance Banking

About The Role 
     

            
    




	The Accountant will support the banks financial operations by maintaining accurate records, preparing financial reports, and ensuring compliance with regulatory and internal accounting standards.
	The role requires hands-on experience within a microfinance or financial services environment and the ability to support audits, reconciliations, and statutory reporting effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate accounting records and general ledger postings.
	Prepare monthly and annual financial statements.
	Handle statutory remittances including PAYE, VAT, WHT, and pensions.
	Support regulatory reporting in line with CBN guidelines.
	Perform daily and monthly bank and account reconciliations.
	Support internal and external audit processes.
	Maintain proper financial documentation and controls.
	Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and procedures.


Qualifications & Experience


	BSc / HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	2–5 years relevant accounting experience in a microfinance bank or financial institution.
	ICAN (ACA) certification required or newly chartered.
	Working knowledge of core banking systems (e.g., Bank-One).
	Strong understanding of regulatory reporting and compliance requirements.
	High attention to detail and integrity.


Application Question(s):


	Do you have experience with working in the banking space?


Experience:


	Accounting: 2 years (Preferred)


License/Certification:


	ACA (Preferred) or Professional level


Location:


	Lagos (Preferred)


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month. 

Application Closing Date: 23rd January, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: au.okpaire@estradaintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Marketing Executive

Job Location: Ketu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Financial Services / Microfinance

Role Overview


	The Marketing Executive will be responsible for driving customer acquisition, deposit mobilization, and market penetration through field marketing and relationship-based sales activities.
	The role focuses on building strong customer relationships, generating leads, and supporting business growth initiatives across retail and SME segments.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive deposit mobilization and customer acquisition initiatives.
	Identify, prospect, and onboard new customers for savings and loan products.
	Conduct field marketing activities, sales campaigns, and community engagements.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing customers.
	Generate leads and support loan origination activities.
	Submit regular sales, activity, and performance reports.
	Collaborate with internal teams to support seamless customer onboarding.
	Promote the organization’s products and services in line with brand guidelines.


Requirements


	BSc / HND in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
	1 - 4 years of experience in sales or marketing within a financial services environment.
	Prior experience in microfinance or deposit mobilization is an advantage.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Target-driven, proactive, and self-motivated.
	Familiarity with Lagos markets, especially the mainland axis, is desirable.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 23rd January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: au.okpaire@estradaintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Event Sales and Operations Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Events & Hospitality

Role Summary


	We’re looking for a proactive and highly organized Sales & Operations Officer to support client inquiries, manage sales documentation, and ensure smooth coordination between sales activities and event operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle client inquiries, quotations, and timely follow-ups.
	Maintain accurate sales records, reports, and client data.
	Coordinate with the operations team to ensure seamless event execution.
	Support overall sales efficiency and client satisfaction.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	1 - 3 years experience in Sales, Operations, or Customer Service.
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.
	Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N200,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: eiss.outsourcing@estradaintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at the Lamb Academy
content:
The Lamb Academy is a newly established schoollocated along Lotto/Shimawa Road, Mowe they offer-spacious and learning-friendly classrooms, well-equipped science laboratories, and specially designed rooms for art, music, and life science; to ensure a well-rounded education for the students, Lekki campus also has the following in-place for sports and recreational activities:- swimming pools, athletics track, basketball courts, football pitches, and tennis courts, all set in a safe and secure school environment.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) School Administrator

Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Brief


	We are looking for a School Administrator to manage all administrative tasks in our school.
	As a School Administrator, you’ll need to wear many different hats; the planner, the problem-solver, the educator and the counselor being a few of them. You should have the skills to communicate with various people, handle budgets and logistics, and keep all educational programs running.
	If you’re up to the task, and you’re also committed to high-quality education, we’d like to meet you.


Responsibilities


	Manage budgets, logistics and events or meetings
	Handle scheduling, record-keeping and reporting
	Ensure the school complies with relevant laws and regulations
	Develop and run educational programs
	Hire, train and advise staff
	Counsel students when needed
	Resolve conflicts and other issues
	Communicate with parents, regulatory bodies and the public
	Have a hand in the creation of the school curriculum
	Implement actions that improve the school and the quality of education (e.g. building renovations, new guidelines for students, new subjects)
	Help shape and uphold the vision of the school.


Requirements and Skills


	Degree in Education or similar field; post-graduate Degree is a plus
	Proven experience as a School Administrator
	Must reside around Mowe, Lotto Asese,Olowotedo and it's environment.
	Experience as an educator is a plus
	Knowledge of administrative processes of schools
	Ability to use computers (e.g. MS Office) and education management systems
	Excellent communication skills
	Outstanding organizational ability
	Attention to detail
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
	Good judgment and decision-making aptitude.


Application Closing Date: 12th January, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Playgroup / Nursery Teacher

Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Educating children about fundamental concepts, such as colors, letters, numbers, and shapes.
	Encouraging social interactions between children and improving their self-esteem.
	Engaging in creative methods of learning, such as arts and crafts, supervised play, and storytelling.
	Planning comprehensive curriculums to address early childhood development needs.
	Instilling a sense of order and discipline in the classroom.
	Monitoring free time on the playground.
	Ensuring the classroom is a clean, safe, and organized environment.
	Preparing for lessons by gathering materials and setting up workstations.
	Communicating with parents to better understand the children's home lives and psyches.
	Writing up reports for parents on each child's developmental progress.


Requirements


	Degree in Education, with a focus on early childhood development.
	3+ years of relevant work experience.
	Experience working with young children in a classroom setting.
	Ability to communicate with young children at their level.
	Patient, compassionate attitude, with a friendly, energetic disposition.
	Good mediation and nurturing abilities.
	Creative mind-set with an ability to create memorable, out-of-the-box lessons.
	Passion for shaping and inspiring young minds.
	Familiarity with Microsoft Word and Excel.


Application Closing Date: 15th January, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Head of School

Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Oversee day-to-day school operations.
	Drive academic excellence and staff performance.
	Foster. safe, disciplined, and inspiring learning environment.
	Excellent Educator.


Requirements


	A relevant Degree and educational qualifications.
	Minimum of 5 years of teaching and leadership experience.
	A science background will be an added advantage.
	Proven leadership in school administration.
	Strong communication and organizational skills.


Application Closing Date: 14th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Head Wealth Manager Job at Prospera Finance




        
    

        
        Prospera Finance, a Finance institution, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head Wealth Manager

Job Location: Festac, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Institution Type: Financial Institution

Role Overview
     

            
    




	The Head of Wealth Management will lead the institution’s wealth management division, overseeing strategy, client relationship management, investment advisory, and portfolio growth.
	This role requires a visionary leader with strong financial acumen, deep knowledge of investment products, and the ability to build trust with high-net-worth clients.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership:


	Develop and implement the wealth management strategy aligned with institutional goals.
	Drive growth in assets under management (AUM) and client acquisition.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain long-term relationships with high-net-worth clients.
	Provide tailored financial advice, investment planning, and estate management solutions.


Investment Oversight:


	Supervise portfolio construction, risk management, and performance monitoring.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and ethical practices.


Team Management:


	Lead, mentor, and develop wealth managers and relationship officers.
	Foster a culture of excellence, integrity, and client-centric service.


Business Development:


	Identify new opportunities for product innovation and market expansion.
	Represent the institution at industry events and networking forums.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related field (Master’s/MBA preferred).
	Professional certifications (CFA, CFP, ICAN, CIS) are highly desirable.
	Minimum 10 years of experience in wealth management, private banking, or investment advisory.
	Proven track record of managing high-net-worth portfolios.
	Strong leadership, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Deep understanding of Nigerian financial markets and global investment trends.


Compensation & Benefits


	Competitive salary package with performance-based incentives.
	Hybrid work model (office presence in Festac + remote flexibility).
	Health insurance, pension contributions, and professional development support.
	Opportunity to shape and grow a premier wealth management division.
